t: Psalm 135
The Lord Is Great
Hallelujah!*pn Praise*ln the name of the Lord.*s Give*ln praise, you servants of the Lord*s
who*ln stand in the house of the Lord,*s in*ln the courts of the house of our God.
Praise*ln the Lord,*s for the Lord*s is good; sing*ln praise to his name, for it is delightful.
For*ln the Lord*s has chosen Jacob for himself, Israel*ln as his treasured possession.
For*pn I know that the Lord*s is great; our*ln Lord is greater than all gods.
The*ln Lord*s does whatever he pleases in*ln heaven and on earth, in*ln the seas and all the depths.
He*ln causes the clouds to rise from the ends of the earth. He*ln makes lightning for the rain and*ln brings the wind from his storehouses.
He*pn struck down the firstborn of Egypt, both*ln people and animals.
He*ln sent signs and wonders against you, Egypt, against*ln Pharaoh and all his officials.
He*ln struck down many nations and*ln slaughtered mighty kings:
Sihon*ln king of the Amorites, Og*ln king of Bashan, and*ln all the kings of Canaan.
He*ln gave their land as an inheritance, an*ln inheritance to his people Israel.
Lord,*spn your name endures forever, your*ln reputation, Lord,*s through*ln all generations.
For*ln the Lord*s will vindicate his people and*ln have compassion on his servants.
The*pn idols of the nations are of silver and gold, made*ln by human hands.
They*ln have mouths but cannot speak, eyes,*ln but cannot see.
They*ln have ears but cannot hear; indeed,*ln there is no breath in their mouths.
Those*ln who make them are just like them, as*ln are all who trust in them.
House*pn of Israel, bless the Lord!*s House*ln of Aaron, bless the Lord!*s
House*ln of Levi, bless the Lord!*s You*ln who revere the Lord,*s bless the Lord!*s
Blessed*ln be the Lord*s from Zion; he*ln dwells in Jerusalem. Hallelujah!*ln
